analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the triads

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ
translated: With a state that is to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a state that is to be abandoned by development arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a state that is to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a state that is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a state that is to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a state that is to be abandoned by development and a state that is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development arise, by way of root-cause condition. … three.

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: With a state that is to be abandoned by development as condition, a state that is to be abandoned by seeing arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ
translated: With a state that is to be abandoned by development as condition, a state that is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a state that is to be abandoned by development as condition, a state that is to be abandoned by seeing and a state that is not to be abandoned by either seeing or development arise, by way of root-cause condition. … three.

original: ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: and things that are to be given up neither through seeing nor through development arise together with a condition being a root condition … three.

original: Nanevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya🔽pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nanevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: na neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya  pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhamma
translated: With a thing that is to be given up neither through seeing nor through development as condition, a thing that is to be given up neither through seeing nor through development …

original: paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: With a thing that is to be given up neither through seeing nor through development as condition, a thing that is to be given up through seeing … five. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: In the section on root cause there are eighteen. In the section on object there are nine. … In the section on result there are three. … In the section on non-distortion there are eighteen.
